Overall Purpose: Deterministically orchestrate a full session walk across rooms, enforce gate chains, and guarantee atomic state continuity from entry to exit.
Why This Matters: Without a governed hallway, rooms drift and sequencing becomes implicit. The hallway provides a single source of truth for order, gating, error containment, and auditability.
When To Use This Protocol: For any session that traverses two or more rooms. Always invoked for standard and mini-walks; also invoked on resume/replay.

Overall Outcomes.Poor: Rooms called ad hoc; gates skipped; partial/contradictory state.
Overall Outcomes.Expected: Sequence usually correct but with inconsistent gating and weak failure handling.
Overall Outcomes.Excellent: Sequence, gates, and state continuity always enforced with structured declines on failure.
Overall Outcomes.Transcendent: Hallway is invisible infrastructure — every session reproducibly walks, resumes, and audits with zero drift. Audit chains and resumability provide future-proof trust.

Themes.Name: Deterministic Sequencing
Themes.Purpose: Run the declared room sequence exactly once each unless explicitly configured for mini-walk variations.
Themes.Why This Matters: Predictable behavior eliminates drift and race conditions.

Outcomes.Transcendent: Sequencing is verified, self-describing, and resilient — supporting replay, resume, and audit-based validation.

Themes.Name: Gate Enforcement
Themes.Purpose: Evaluate gate chains before each room and short-circuit on deny.

Outcomes.Excellent: All configured gates enforced in order with AND semantics.
Outcomes.Transcendent: Gate decisions become structural — reproducible, logged, and replayable. Governance is guaranteed regardless of operator or context.

Themes.Name: State Continuity & Atomicity
Themes.Purpose: Carry forward session state atomically; no partial commits.

Outcomes.Excellent: All-or-nothing across each step; resumable on failure.
Outcomes.Transcendent: Checkpointing and resumability are invisible — any interruption can be resumed from last safe state without loss, ensuring permanent continuity.

Themes.Name: Error Containment
Themes.Purpose: Fail fast with structured declines; never crash the process.
Themes.Why This Matters: Keeps the system trustworthy under pressure.

Outcomes.Expected: Some declines but leaky side effects.
Outcomes.Excellent: Structured declines; no side effects on failure.
Outcomes.Transcendent: Error containment becomes invisible safety net — failures never propagate, rollback/resume always safe, integrity never compromised.

Themes.Name: Observability & Audit
Themes.Purpose: Emit structured events for every gate and room step; produce a final hallway summary.

Outcomes.Excellent: Per-step events with inputs/outputs (hashed) and decisions.
Outcomes.Transcendent: Full audit chain is structural — sessions can be verified externally with cryptographic hashes, providing future-proof governance.

Completion Prompts: Was the declared sequence executed deterministically?
Were all gate chains evaluated and recorded?
Were state transitions atomic and resumable?
Were errors contained via structured declines?
Was an auditable hallway summary produced?
